intro: Perityle fitchii, commonly known as the Fitch's perityle, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of California. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically pale green to white in color. Perityle fitchii thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
